title: At least 200 killed, hundreds injured in train crash in India
description: At least 200 people have been killed and hundreds more injured in a train accident in India, as the death toll continues to rise, officials said.

title: COVID cases could be ticking up in nation's largest city, wastewater data shows
description: Data from New York City's wastewater surveillance shows high levels of COVID detection, suggesting the virus could be ticking up, but experts say not to panic yet.

title: Arsenal of firearms found in NYC apartment after fatal shooting
description: A New York City man accused of fatally shooting an apparent assailant outside his apartment building allegedly had an arsenal of firearms and body armor in his home.

title: Two more Oath Keeper defendants sentenced for Jan. 6 sedition
description: Two more Oath Keeper defendants receive their sentences for Jan. 6 sedition.

title: Protests erupt outside Los Angeles elementary school's Pride month assembly
description: Police officers are separating protesters and counterprotesters outside a Los Angeles elementary school that has become a flashpoint for LGBTQ+ issues involving children in California during Pride month

title: Trump asks judge in criminal case to step aside due to his daughter's Democratic ties
description: Former President Trump has asked the judge overseeing his criminal case in New York City to step aside, citing the judge’s daughter’s ties to a Democratic organization.

title: Biden to give prime-time address on debt ceiling deal that averts default
description: Biden's expected to tout the bill as a win for Americans, and proof of his ability to keep the nation on track, amid the backdrop of his 2024 reelection campaign.

title: Passenger train derails in India, killing at least 50 and trapping many others
description: Two passenger trains have derailed in India, killing at least 50 people and trapping hundreds of others inside more than a dozen damaged coaches

title: Tropical Storm Arlene, 1st of season, forms in Gulf of Mexico
description: Tropical Storm Arlene, the first named storm of the Atlantic hurricane season, has formed in the Gulf of Mexico

title: 6-year-old horse dies at Belmont Park after race injury
description: A 6-year-old horse died after being injured in a race at Belmont Park ahead of next week’s Triple Crown finale in New York

title: Records detail Jeffrey Epstein's last days and prison system's scramble after suicide
description: Nearly four years after Jeffrey Epstein's death, thousands of pages of records obtained by The Associated Press are shedding new light on the financier’s time behind bars

title: 3 dead, 3 injured in stabbing, car-ramming spree
description: Three people have been killed and three others injured in a Northern California crime spree.

title: Disney lawsuit judge removes himself from case but not for reasons cited by DeSantis
description: A federal judge overseeing the First Amendment lawsuit that Walt Disney Parks filed against Gov. Ron DeSantis and others is disqualifying himself, but not because of bias claims made by the Florida governor

title: North Carolina's Fort Bragg drops Confederate namesake, renamed Fort Liberty
description: While the previously renamed bases were chosen to honor past soldiers or Army families, Fort Liberty was named after no one person.

title: Pence cleared in classified documents investigation, DOJ says
description: The DOJ has notified former VP Mike Pence that no criminal charges will be sought in their probe into his handling of classified documents after leaving office.

title: Wegmans to close Massachusetts store because of slow business
description: The Wegmans supermarket chain is closing one of its largest and most unusual stores because it has not attracted enough business

title: Judge approves settlement in 'Rust' lawsuit against Alec Baldwin
description: A settlement was reached in a lawsuit filed by cinematographer Halyna Hutchins' family over her death on the movie set of the film "Rust."

title: Milwaukee school bus engulfed in flames after driver safely evacuates 37 students
description: A school bus in Milwaukee was engulfed in flames moments after the pregnant driver safely evacuated 37 students

title: Officials: 5,000-acre wildfire 50% contained; New Jersey highway still shut down
description: A long stretch of New Jersey's Garden State Parkway is shut down as firefighters work to contain a 5,000-acre forest fire

title: Scripps National Spelling Bee champ confidently spells 'psammophile'
description: Dev Shah was crowned the 2023 Scripps National Spelling Bee champion after correctly spelling "psammophile."

title: Biden to enforce ban on oil, gas drilling to protect New Mexico tribal sites
description: The Biden administration is implementing a 20-year withdrawal banning oil and gas development outside the boundaries of Chaco Culture National Historical Park in northwestern New Mexico

title: Ford urges owners of some SUVs to park outdoors due to fire risk with engines off
description: Ford is telling owners of more than 140,000 SUVs in the U.S. to park them outside because they can catch fire even when the engines are turned off

title: Rain forecast in Nova Scotia promises relief after week of wildfires
description: Rain and a rainy forecast for the weekend have fire officials hopeful they can get the largest wildfire ever recorded in Canada’s Atlantic Coast province of Nova Scotia under control

title: US employers added a strong 339,000 jobs in May as labor market stays durable
description: A surprisingly resilient job market has delivered another month of solid hiring.

title: Jill Biden arrives in Cairo as part of Mideast tour aiming to empower women, youth
description: Jill Biden has arrived in Cairo on the second leg of her six-day trip across the Middle East, North Africa and Europe that seeks to promote empowerment for women and education for young people

title: Some trans people turn to crowdfunding to leave Florida after anti-LGBTQ+ laws
description: Dozens of transgender people in Florida who can't afford to move are turning to crowdfunding to help them leave after the passage of new legislation that targets the LGBTQ community

title: Tropical Storm Mawar brings heavy rains, landslide risk to Japan's southern islands
description: A weakened Tropical Storm Mawar is bringing heavy rains to Japan's main southern islands after passing the Okinawan archipelago early Friday

title: Library cancels trans speaker after Montana bans drag readings
description: Montana's new law banning drag reading events at public libraries has led to the cancellation of a transgender speaker in a southwestern Montana city on Friday

title: NBA planning to announce latest Ja Morant decision after Finals, Silver says
description: The latest sanctions, if any, that the NBA plans to levy against Memphis guard Ja Morant for his second instance of displaying a gun on social media will be announced shortly after the finals, Commissioner Adam Silver said Thursday

title: Judge delays first criminal trial in Elijah McClain's death
description: A judge in Colorado has agreed to delay the first criminal trial in the death of Elijah McClain, a 23-year-old Black man who was stopped by police, forcibly restrained and injected with a powerful sedative nearly four years ago

title: US, Taiwan sign trade deal over China's opposition
description: The United States has signed a trade agreement with Taiwan over opposition from China, which claims the self-ruled island democracy as part of its territory

title: Senate passes debt ceiling deal, staving off default
description: The Fiscal Responsibility Act, the product of weeks of negotiation between Biden and McCarthy, will raise the debt limit until January 2025 and enact some spending cuts.

title: Fatal attack on Home Depot worker underscores dangers of organized retail crime
description: The son of a Home Depot worker who was fatally attacked during a theft is pushing for a crackdown on organized retail crime, the large-scale theft of high-value items.

title: Teen killed after shoplifting allegations remembered as 'intelligent, humorous'
description: A teen who police say was fatally shot by a gas station owner was remembered by his middle school as "intelligent" and "humorous."

title: Judge rules Andrew Lester case to be partially sealed in the shooting of Ralph Yarl
description: A Clay County, Missouri judge agreed to partially seal the case of Andrew Lester, who is charged with first-degree assault in the shooting of teenager Ralph Yarl.
